comment:
Took Javani for Lecture and Lab for Physics II.
class can be difficult at times, but Javani helps
Homework is horrible as usual but he opens up it all again at the end of the semester though.
He gives breakout quizzes almost every week. These quizzes are based on the lecture material and reflect what will be on the exams almost perfectly.
Best Physics professor I've ever taken. Tries so hard for his students to understand lectures and begs you to ask any questions you have. Tests are from the quizzes after each chapter.

Dr. Javani is a caring professor. Physics is an extremely difficult class, and I often got lost in his lectures. He is extremely accessible outside the classroom and really wants to make sure you're doing well both in the class and out. Tests are more like quizzes than homework, and he gives partial credit for semi-correct answers.

This is not an easy class, and the professor did not help that much at all.  While he seems to know what he is talking about well enough, he doesnt explain how to do problems very well unless you ask him directly, which can get tedious.  Be prepared to teach yourself everything. Not very considerate.

Javani's lectures are alright, but you can get away with just reading the book. Pay attention to the breakout session questions as they will make up for most of the questions on the exams. Grading was pretty fair overall and with a cheat sheet for every exam, you'll be good.

Took physics w/ him this semester after taking AP in high school. Having previous knowledge it was mostly relearning for me. I haven't gone to lecture since like September and got 100/95/100 on the midterms so far. Do all practice problems in textbook and retry WebAssign before test and you'll be good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Javani was awesome in lab. There is no TA, and he explains all the formulas and procedure beforehand, which was great since I am taking the lab in a separate semester from my lecture. He always responds to emails and is able to answer any question.

B in Calc 1, A in Calc 2, I'm good at math. This guy is really nice, but nice doesn't make you good at teaching. He moves too fast. He writes right to left which takes a minute to get used to. He writes kinda small on the whiteboard so you have to sit close. Few test questions, so any wrong and you'll fail. What he teaches & HW are very different.
Very easy going instructor, always ready to help even out of class hours, inspire students to lead on their project and offer additional help if need it. Faster response when email him.

Professor Javani does a great job on providing real world examples to various concepts. He is always willing to help a student if questions arise. He also does a great job of taking a fairly bland subject for most and making it as entertaining as possible. In addition his in class examples are simple allowing for easier understanding of concepts. S

He was the best physics professor that I have. He cared about students. He was available whenever I needed him. He responded to my email within 10 min. He tried to answer my questions via several emails back and forth, even very late evening. Overall, I was really happy with his teaching and this class.

I can't stress enough how unclear this guy is, especially when teaching. Yeah sure his tests are mostly homework questions (not ALL) and he gives a formula sheet, but he doesn't allow you to write the problems from the homework (which you might need to survive the exams since this guy doesn't make sense). Complete gpa killer and would NOT recommend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: his test come from webassign hw. Do all your hw for the semester in one hit because we all know youll do it last hour before its due. Dont do that. He grades hard. If its wrong its wrong no matter how much its worth. His partial credit is arguing with him that you knew the process only to get 1 point back out of 10. Cool guy but tough class
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you want an A then you need to write out every problem on your cheat sheet for the exams. Take a picture of it before each exam because he keeps it. Also don't do your homework last minute. Good guy and caring but his grading doesn't make sense. Average for the final exam was probably a 30 but he curves the final grade harrrd.

He doesn't care too much about what you have to say. Your wrong and that's it. If you ask a question he will treat you like your stupid. His tests come from WebAssign so copy all formulas you use on there for his tests. He says he gives partial credit which he does but it will be 1 or 2 points out of 5-10, SOMETIMES.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had never taken a Physics class before and his method of teaching was very challenging for me. He only goes through problems and I need more visuals and clearer explanations than what he gave. I got my first F on a test in his class, it is a very challenging class. Be ready to eat sleep and breathe physics if you want a good grade.

Professor Javani was entertaining and did his best to help you succeed. 4 tests, lowest dropped, and a final. The tests are based on homework questions, and homework questions can be solved by attending class and watching him do example problems from the textbook. It's a tough class, but he's a good teacher and a good guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Considering the horrible things I have heard about other physics professors, I am extremely glad I took Jovani. The test consists of 3 tests(1 dropped), a final, and homework, but the tests are heavily based upon the homework assignments. In addition, he allows you to make a formula sheet for each test which is incredibly helpful.
such a nice guy just do the hw youll be set. memorize the hw. you can write own formula sheet take him dude

I'm not sure how others weren't doing well before, but he's a decent prof. Teaches from the book and does many examples. If you take notes in class, review the problems from the book, and do the webassign hw and understand it, you'll pass. His tests are similar to hw problems so it's up to you to study it. No quizzes, 3 tests and one is dropped.

His english s not the best and often likes to use slightly abstract examples, but he does a good job of explaining the material. teaches straight out of the book, and his tests are almost identical to the homework he assigns. If you can do any homework question within 10 min, you are set for an A. Allows formula sheet on test.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Taking him for my physics 1 lab has been fairly simple. He explains the background information of what we will be conducting and if you take notes, finishing the lab will be a breeze. The first few labs took some getting used to, but Ive grown to like his teaching style and he allows students to make-up any lost points prior labs for full credit.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is good and funny guy. He knows that Physics is hard so he tries his best to make it easier. He allows Formula sheets in tests (Just fill them from Homework questions on Webassign) He also gives many extra credit. In every test he gives like 55 points and only grade. He also gives other Extra Points that worth at least 1 full percent each.

Formula Sheets are allowed. Just do a formula sheet from the homework and you are set for the test. He gave 2 midterms and Final 25% each, and the other 25% are just super easy. He gives A LOT of extra credit.

His tests come straight from WebAssign OR the questions from the book he'll go over on the board. YOU have to put the MAX AFFORD into studying and understanding the material so you can do well in his class. He'll give you extra credit problems to help raise your final grade up too. Entertaining guy! I highly recommend him.

Dont know if the class itself was hard or just the teacher. Either way he didnt make much easier. Hes a great guy but I dont believe that hes a great teacher. Hw is all wedassign and the test come from the hw but its still not easy and its only 5 question no multiple choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: take him

Terrible professor. Doesn't know how to translate to say what he wants to. Asks the class what words mean and how to spell them during lecture. Tests are extremely short and difficult. With 5 questions and a formula sheet, you better hope you have the correct formula from many chapters. Take anybody but this professor.

No. Just no. Funny guy and all, but not a good teacher. His class is such a struggle. Good luck getting out with an A or B. An A would seem almost impossible. Getting a B will take a lot of hard work and studying. I would not take him again.

Horrible. Doesn't teach well. Tests are impossible even with formula sheet. I feel like Kennesaw will hire any professor. Kennesaw really needs to start hiring better STEM professors. For calc, physics and Chem they are barely any good professors and us as the students are the ones who have to suffer.

I had him for lecture, and he's a great guy who has a passion for physics. very funny, and very helpful. However, his english sometimes fails him when he tries explaining complicated physics concepts. but it is a very difficult class. Tests are 5 questions, come from the homework or class, but still insanely hard, even with a formula sheet.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Javani is good at teaching physics in a non-complicated way and will go out of his way to explain the concept if you don't understand it. The class itself is as hard as it gets, but his test questions come from the homework and the notes. Homework was slightly minimal, at most 15-20 webassign problems a week.
Class was super hard. Teaching style was difficult to understand. I would recommend a different teacher.
Nice guy and compared to other lab prof. he is easy. Just turn in your Lab and that is it.
Class was hard. Teaching style in my opinion was difficult to understand.
Great professor. Teaching style was really helpful and always available for help. Class was an easy A. If you have the option to take him don't pass it up! I'm going to try and take him for physics 2

Not a bad professor.. Physics is just hard in general. Tests are 5 questions and are honestly pretty basic. The questions come straight from the book, HW, and examples from lectures so you study every single one of those and you should do fine. If I knew his teaching style earlier in the year I probably would've made an A or B for sure.
